When a factory burns fossil fuels, carbon moves into the atmosphere in the form of carbon dioxide. As a result of human activity, atmospheric levels of carbon dioxide are rising and contributing to climate change.

Learn more

Cows raised using industrial farming practices release carbon into the atmosphere in the form of methane gas, as well as through soil depletion.

Learn about alternatives

Plants absorb carbon from the atmosphere through photosynthesis. From there it either returns the soil through decomposition or enters the food chain through animal consumption.
